Entities.Name: Patient
Entities.Definition: The primary subject of the healthcare data, typically identified by an ID.
Entities.Sample Data: Patient entity is related to demographics with the relationship, hasDemographics with the domain ‘patient’ and range ‘demographics’.

Entities.Name: Demographics
Entities.Definition: Demographic details of the patient such as age, gender, ethnicity, etc.
Entities.Sample Data: Ontology developed to store patient’s demographic details.

Entities.Name: Disease
Entities.Definition: Medical conditions or diseases affecting the patient.
Entities.Sample Data: Disease ontology contains data on diseases.

Entities.Name: Symptoms
Entities.Definition: Observable signs or symptoms indicating the presence of a disease.
Entities.Sample Data: Symptom ontology helps to identify symptoms in a patient.

Entities.Name: Radiology Information
Entities.Sample Data: RadLex aids in identifying image findings in a clinical narrative.

Dataset.Name: MIMIC-III
Dataset.Details: Contains detailed and de-identified health-related data suitable for biomedical and healthcare analysis.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Uses NLP, NER, and biomedical ontologies to map clinical findings from narratives to structured formats.
